description: Currants are small, round berries that grow in clusters on bushes. They come in red, black, and white varieties, each with distinct flavors. Red currants are tart and bright, while black currants are more intense and earthy.

flavor_profile.notes: Very tart with bright, acidic flavor and subtle floral notes

storage_tips: Store fresh currants in the refrigerator for 3-5 days. Handle gently as they are delicate. For longer storage, freeze on a baking sheet, then transfer to freezer bags. Frozen currants work well for jams.
preparation: Wash gently and remove stems. For jams, can be used whole or lightly crushed. The high tartness makes them excellent for jams when combined with sugar and other fruits.
